common

Class AbstractByteReaderOrig

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractByteReaderOrig

  • public abstract class AbstractByteReaderOrig
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the functionality to perform reader operations intended for obtaining data from a byte array. Data can either be read sequentially or at random, depending on the implementing sub-classes.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractByteReaderOrig

        public AbstractByteReaderOrig(byte[] buf,
                              long offset,
                              java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly. The offset specifies the starting position within the array to read from.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes acting as the buffer
        offset - specifies the starting position within the specified array
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

    • Method Detail

      • validateByteIndex

        private void validateByteIndex(long position,
                               int length)
        Checks whether the specified position is within the byte array's bounds. If the position is out of range, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - the position in the byte array
        length - the total length within the byte array to check
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is out of bounds

      • getByte

        protected byte getByte(long position)
        Returns a single byte from the array at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the index in the byte array from where the data should be returned
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified position

      • getBytes

        protected byte[] getBytes(long position,
                          int length)
        Copies and returns a sub-array from the byte array, starting from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the index within the byte array from which to start copying
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the specified subset of the original array

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining(long position)
        Checks if there are more bytes available to read.
        Parameters:
        position - the current read index within the byte array
        Returns:
        true if the buffer has remaining unread bytes, false otherwise

      • getBaseOffset

        public long getBaseOffset()
        Retrieves the offset pointer to the byte array, where read operations can start from.
        Returns:
        the base offset

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Sets the byte order for interpreting the input bytes correctly, based on either the Motorola big endian-ness or Intel little endian-ness format. Use ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN for image files following the Motorola endian-ness order, where the Most Significant Bit (MSB) precedes the Least Significant Bit (LSB). This order is also referred to as network byte order. Use ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN for image files following Intel's little-endian order. In contrast to Motorola's byte order, the LSB comes before the MSB.
        Parameters:
        order - the byte order for interpreting the input bytes, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN (Motorola) or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN (Intel)

      • getByteOrder

        public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        See Also:
        for more details

      • length

        public long length()
        Returns the length of the byte array minus the initial offset length.
        Returns:
        the array length

      • peek

        public byte peek(long offset)
        Retrieves the data at the specified offset within the byte array without advancing the position.

        A call to this method is equivalent to getByte(position), but does not advance any position counters.

        Parameters:
        offset - the offset from the beginning of the byte array to fetch the data
        Returns:
        the byte of data

      • peek

        public byte[] peek(long offset,
                   int length)
        Retrieves up to the specified length of a sub-array of bytes at the specified offset without advancing the position of the original array.

        A call to this method is equivalent to getByte(position, length), but does not advance any position counters.

        Parameters:
        offset - the offset from the beginning of the byte array to fetch the data
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array
        Returns:
        the byte containing the data

      • printRawBytes

        public void printRawBytes()
        Primarily intended for debugging purposes, it prints out a series of raw byte values.
